headline: Keurig Dr Pepper Announces Updated Financing Plan for JDE Peet's Acquisition
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. (NASDAQ: KDP; "the Company") today announced updated financing plans and transaction timelines for the acquisition of JDE Peet's and subsequent planned separation into two independent companies ("Beverage Co." and "Global Coffee Co." pending the announcement of official corporate names).

raw.headline: Keurig Dr Pepper Announces Updated Financing Plan for JDE Peet's Acquisition

(NASDAQ: KDP; "the Company") today announced updated financing plans and transaction timelines for the acquisition of JDE Peet's and subsequent planned separation into two independent companies ("Beverage Co." and "Global Coffee Co." pending the announcement of official corporate names).

headline: Alternative Managers’ Woes Deepen Amid Software Slump. The Pressure Has Been Building.
summary: A selloff in software is spilling into BDCs and alternative asset managers, with investors newly focused on private-credit exposure and redemption risk.

raw.headline: Alternative Managers’ Woes Deepen Amid Software Slump. The Pressure Has Been Building.

headline: Without AI spending, U.S. corporate investment in equipment would be negative, a decline that’s ‘worryingly broad-based,’ Pantheon analyst says
summary: Consumer spending is affected too, because it is heavily driven by spending from wealthier demographics who have enjoyed stock market gains, often from tech stocks, Pantheon’s Oliver Allen says.

raw.headline: Without AI spending, U.S. corporate investment in equipment would be negative, a decline that’s ‘worryingly broad-based,’ Pantheon analyst says
raw.summary: Consumer spending is affected too, because it is heavily driven by spending from wealthier demographics who have enjoyed stock market gains, often from tech stocks, Pantheon’s Oliver Allen says.

headline: Software, Payments Shares Tumble After Citrini Post on AI Risks
summary: DoorDash Inc., American Express Co. and Blackstone Inc all slumped more than 7%.  Shares of other companies name-checked in the article, including Uber Technologies Inc., Mastercard Inc., Visa Inc, Capital One Financial Corp., Apollo Global Management Inc. and KKR & Co. Inc. were all lower by at least 3%.

Inc. were all lower by at least 3%.
